project.description: This would be cleaner and more portable if it was a python script that check for initialization.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash source "/var/jenkins_home/workspace/Check For Updates/role_functions.sh"
cd app-infrastructure
terraform init aws s3 cp s3://$stack_s3_bucket/deployment_state_metadata/${target_stack}/terraform.tfstate .
output_names=$(terraform output -json | jq -r 'keys[]') echo "Output names: $output_names"
for output_name in $output_names; do reset_role assume_role
echo "Current instance: ${output_name}." INSTANCE_ID=`terraform output "${output_name}"`
# Skip if the instance ID is empty if [ -z "$INSTANCE_ID" ]; then echo "No instance ID for output ${output_name}. Skipping..." continue fi
echo "Instance-id is $INSTANCE_ID"
aws --region=us-east-1 ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=${INSTANCE_ID}" while [ $(aws --region=us-east-1 ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=${INSTANCE_ID}" | grep InitComplete | wc -l ) -eq 0 ]; do echo "${output_name} EC2 still initializing" sleep 60 done echo "${output_name} EC2 Initialization Complete" done
